intro: Bartsia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Bartsia latifolia is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
